newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ayala says high-end housing market to soften.
newsitem.headline: Ayala says high-end housing market to soften.

text.p: Ayala Corp president Jaime Augusto Zobel de Ayala said on Friday the high-end residential sector was the most likely to experience a slight softening in demand in the coming years.
"If there'll be a little bit of weakness, I think it will be in the residential high-end side (of the market)," Zobel said in a cable television interview.
He said supply in the sector has been growing in the past years.
Zobel is also the vice chairman of Ayala Land Inc, Ayala Corp's core company. Ayala Land has a wide array of real estate projects, including high-rise residential buildings.
He remained bullish, however, on the real estate industry, saying higher economic growth would create greater demand for housing, commercial and office spaces.
The Philippine property market was recently shaken by widespread fears of a possible glut and a cooldown in prices.
"To say there's a property glut...is looking at the whole situation very wrong. The property market has very many areas to it," Zobel added.
